Call.description: Generates yield by running an automated {{asset}} covered call strategy.

strategy.default: The vault earns yield on its {{asset}} deposits by running a weekly automated <0></0> strategy. The vault reinvests the yield earned back into the strategy, effectively compounding the yields for depositors over time.
strategy.yieldAssetCollateral: The vault earns yield on its {{asset}} deposits by running a weekly automated {{asset}} <0></0> strategy where it stakes its {{asset}} deposits in <1></1> and then uses its <2></2> to collateralize weekly out-of-money {{asset}} call options. The yield earned from both the covered call strategy and the {{asset}} staking rewards are reinvested weekly, effectively compounding the yields for depositors over time.

Call.explanation: A covered call refers to a financial transaction in which the investor selling call options owns an equivalent amount of the underlying security.
Call.vaultRisk: The primary risk for running this covered call strategy is that the vault may incur a weekly loss in the case where the call options sold by the vault expire <0></0> (meaning the price of {{optionAsset}} is above the strike price of the call options minted by the vault).

Put.description: Generates yield by running an automated {{asset}} put selling strategy.

strategy.default: {{vault}} earns yield on its {{asset}} deposits by running a weekly automated {{optionAsset}} <0></0> strategy, where the put options are collateralized by {{asset}}. The vault reinvests the yield it earns back into the strategy, effectively compounding the yields for depositors over time.
strategy.yieldAssetCollateral: {{vault}} earns yield on its {{asset}} deposits by running a weekly automated {{optionAsset}} <0></0> strategy, where the put options are collateralized by <1></1>. The vault reinvests the yield it earns back into the strategy, effectively compounding the yields for depositors over time.

Put.explanation: A put option is a derivative instrument which gives the holder the right to sell an asset, at a specified price, by a specified date to the writer of the put.
Put.vaultRisk: The primary risk for running this put selling strategy is that the vault may incur a weekly loss in the case where the put options sold by the vault expire <0></0> (meaning the price of {{optionAsset}} is below the strike price of the put options minted by the vault). Such a situation is expected to happen less than 5% of the time.

TooltipExplanations.rToken: {{rTokenSymbol}} is a token that represents {{depositAsset}} deposits in the {{vaultType}} ({{tokenTitle}}).

InTheMoney.title: IN-THE-MONEY
InTheMoney.explanation: An {{optionAsset}} {{optionType}} option is in-the-money (ITM) if the strike price is {{exercisedDirection}} the market price of {{optionAsset}}.

veRBN.description: Your veRBN balance represents your voting power. The longer you lock your RBN the more veRBN you receive. Your voting power decreases linearly as the remaining time until the RBN lockup expiry decreases.

lockedRBN.title: Locked RBN
lockedRBN.description: The amount of RBN locked up in the governance contract. The longer you lock up RBN the more veRBN (voting power) you receive.

unlockedRBN.description: The amount of RBN that has not been locked in the governance contract.

YieldCard.fundsReadyForMigration: Funds ready for migration to v2
YieldCard.yieldExplainerDesc: Vault yield is calculated by annualising the 4-week average weekly yield generated by the vault. The weekly yield does not include any losses incurred by the vault.

maxDeposit.explanation: This vault has a max deposit of {{maxDeposit}} {{asset}} per depositor

VaultV2DepositWithdrawForm.swapBTC: Swap your BTC or renBTC for wBTC
